apache2: The Apache HTTP Server is a free and open-source cross-platform web server software.
github: GitHub is a developer platform that allows developers to create, store, manage and share their code.
bash: <abbr title="Bourne-Again shell">Bash</abbr> is a shell program and command language supported by the <abbr title="Free Software Foundation">FSF</abbr> and first developed for the <abbr title="GNU is Not Unix">GNU</abbr> Project by Brian Fox.
blender: Blender is a free and open-source 3D computer graphics software tool set.
c: C is a general-purpose programming language. It was created in the 1970s by Dennis Ritchie and remains very widely used and influential.
cities-skylines: Cities: Skylines is a 2015 city-building game developed by Colossal Order and published by Paradox Interactive. The game is a single-player open-ended city-building simulation.
cpp: C++ is a high-level, general-purpose programming language created by Danish computer scientist Bjarne Stroustrup.
csharp: C# is a general-purpose high-level programming language supporting multiple paradigms.
css: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) is a style sheet language used for specifying the presentation and styling of a document written in a markup language such as HTML or XML.
csv: Comma-separated values (CSV) is a text file format that uses commas to separate values, and newlines to separate records.
dotnet: The .NET platform is a free and open-source, managed computer software framework for Windows, Linux, and macOS operating systems.
figma: Figma is a collaborative web application for interface design.
gloomaps: GlooMaps is a simple online visual sitemap tool.
html: <abbr title="HyperText Markup Language">HTML</abbr> is the standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed in a web browser. It defines the content and structure of web content.
inno-setup: Inno Setup is a free software script-driven installation system created in Delphi by Jordan Russell. The first version was released in 1997.
java: Java is a high-level, class-based, object-oriented programming language that is designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible.
javascript: JavaScript, often abbreviated as JS, is a programming language and core technology of the Web, alongside HTML and CSS.
json: <abbr title="JavaScript Object Notation">JSON</abbr> is an open standard file format and data interchange format that uses human-readable text to store and transmit data objects consisting of attributeâ€“value pairs and arrays (or other serializable values).
lua: Lua is a lightweight, high-level, multi-paradigm programming language designed primarily for embedded use in applications.
markdown: Markdown is a lightweight markup language for creating formatted text using a plain-text editor.
minecraft: Minecraft is a 2011 sandbox game developed by Mojang Studios and originally released in 2009.
mysql: MySQL is an open-source relational database management system.
pascal: Pascal is an imperative and procedural programming language, designed by Niklaus Wirth as a small, efficient language intended to encourage good programming practices using structured programming and data structuring.
pgsql: PostgreSQL, also known as Postgres, is a free and open-source relational database management system.
php: <abbr title="Personal Homepage">PHP</abbr> is a general-purpose scripting language geared towards web development, created in 1993.
powershell: PowerShell is a task automation and configuration management program from Microsoft, consisting of a command-line shell and the associated scripting language.
python: Python is a high-level, general-purpose programming language. Its design philosophy emphasizes code readability with the use of significant indentation.
replit: Replit is an American start-up and an online IDE that allows creating online programming projects called repls.
sass: <abbr title="Syntactically Awesome Style Sheets">Sass</abbr> is a preprocessor scripting language that is interpreted or compiled into CSS.
scheme: Scheme is a dialect of the Lisp family of programming languages. Scheme was created during the 1970s at the <abbr title="MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory">MIT AI</abbr> Lab).
smalltalk: Smalltalk is a purely object oriented programming language (OOP) that was originally created in 1972 for educational use.
sql: <abbr title="Structured Query Language">SQL</abbr> is a domain-specific language used to manage data, especially in relational database management systems.
sql-workbench: SQLite is a database engine written in the C programming language.
sqlite: SQL Workbench/J is a DBMS-independent, cross-platform SQL query tool.
svg: <abbr title="Scalable Vector Graphics">SVG</abbr> is an XML-based vector image format for defining two-dimensional graphics, having support for interactivity and animation.
tkinter: Tkinter is a Python binding to the Tk GUI toolkit. It is the standard Python interface to the Tk GUI toolkit.
visual-studio: Visual Studio is an <abbr title="Integrated Development Environment">IDE</abbr> developed by Microsoft. It is used to develop computer programs.
vs-code: Visual Studio Code, also commonly referred to as VS Code,[9] is a source-code editor developed by Microsoft for Windows, Linux, macOS and web browsers.
winforms: Windows Forms is a free and open-source graphical class library included as a part of Microsoft .NET, .NET Framework or Mono.
wpf: <abbr title="Windows Presentation Foundation">WPF</abbr> is a free and open-source user interface framework for Windows-based desktop applications.
xml: <abbr title="Extensible Markup Language">XML</abbr> is a markup language and file format for storing, transmitting, and reconstructing arbitrary data.
zig: Zig is an imperative, general-purpose, statically typed, compiled system programming language designed by Andrew Kelley in 2015 as a successor to C.
